data.title: Richard R. Sigafus
data.meta_description: Richard R. Sigafus, 77, of South Wayne, Wis., died on Thursday, Sept. 11, 2008, at Pleasant View Nursing Home.
data.text:
Richard R. Sigafus, 77, of South Wayne, Wis., died on Thursday, Sept. 11, 2008, at Pleasant View Nursing Home.

He was born on April 23, 1931, in Jo Daviess County, son of Benjamin “Harry” and Mary (Metcalf) Sigafus. Richard and Carol Jean Maves were married on July 19, 1952.

Richard farmed and worked construction in the South Wayne area the greater part of his life.

Surviving are his children, Scott Sigafus and Randy (Jennifer) Sigafus, both of the South Wayne area, Paula (Michael) Ovist of Beloit, Wis., Lorna (Tony) Riedel of Winslow, Karen (Dave) Zimmerman of Verona, Wis., and Mary Peters of Beloit; 20 grandchildren; nine great-grandchildren; brothers, Earl (Paula) Sigafus of Couch, Mo., and John (Rita) Sigafus of Browntown, Wis.; sisters, Viva Manthei of Forreston, Helen Fox of Freeport, Dolly Siemens of Shannon, Harriet (Ralph) Fryer of Freeport and Carol (Gary) Meier of South Wayne; and sister-in-law, Charlene Sigafus of Valley Mills, Texas.

He was predeceased by his parents; wife, Carol in 1998; son, Dennis in 1979; brothers, Mike, Charlie and Gordon; and sisters, Violet and Eleanor.

The funeral will be held at 11 a.m. Tuesday, Sept. 16, at Our Savior Lutheran Church in South Wayne. Officiating will be Pastor Dennis Perger. Burial will be at Union Cemetery in South Wayne.

A visitation will be held from 4 to 8 p.m. Monday, Sept. 15, at the church.

A memorial fund has been established in Richard’s memory.

The Hanson Funeral Home is serving the family.
